column1: In the middle ages, the name was believed to mean ''rosa munda'', Latin for "pure rose", but it derived from ''hros'' "horse" and ''mund'' "hand, protection".<ref>[[Jim Allan]] (ed.), ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of Names"</ref>
